qas.question: What was a consequence of the Roman Empire being divided?

answers.text: the Western Roman Empire lost contact with much of its past

qas.question: Where was support found for Greek philosophy?
What time period was marked by the spreading of Islam?
How long did the Islamic Golden Age last?
What language did Muslim philosophers speak?

context: With the division of the Roman Empire, <a0_0>the Western Roman Empire lost contact with much of its past<a0_0/>. In the Middle East, Greek philosophy was able to find some support under the newly created <a1_0>Arab Empire<a1_0/>. With the spread of Islam in <a2_0>the 7th and 8th centuries<a2_0/>, a period of Muslim scholarship, known as the Islamic Golden Age, lasted <a3_0>until the 13th century<a3_0/>. This scholarship was aided by several factors. The use of a single language, <a4_0>Arabic<a4_0/>, allowed communication without need of a translator. Access to Greek texts from the Byzantine Empire, along with Indian sources of learning, provided Muslim scholars a knowledge base to build upon.
